DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure ERBB2 Receptor Protein-Tyrosine Kinase Medical Contraindication Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether anti-HER2 therapy was medically contraindicated.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure ERBB2 Receptor Protein-Tyrosine Kinase Medical Contraindication
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a therapeutic procedure (an action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process) involving HER2 (the ERBB2 gene that encodes a putative tyrosine kinase growth factor receptor EGFR2, p185 HER2/NEU antigen, similar to the EGF receptor) and a medical contraindication (any special symptom or circumstance that renders the carrying out of a procedure inadvisable, usually because of the risk).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: ERBB2 Receptor Protein-Tyrosine Kinase Medical Contraindication
Property.preferredDefinition: The ERBB2 gene encodes a putative tyrosine kinase growth factor receptor EGFR2, p185 HER2/NEU antigen, similar to the EGF receptor.  The ERBB2, ERBB3, and ERBB4 genes encode heregulin/neuregulin receptors, members of the EGFR-related type I receptor tyrosine kinase subfamily.  The encoded proteins form homo- and heterodimers, which complicates assignment of function: ERBB2 homodimers do not bind heregulin, but ERBB2/ERBB3 heterodimers do.  Herstatin is a secreted alternative ERBB2 product, of the extracellular domain, that binds to p185ERBB2, disrupts ERBB2 dimers, reduces p185 phosphorylation, and inhibits growth.  Human ERBB2 gene is located at 17p12-21.  Overexpression of HER-2 correlates with poor prognosis in breast carcinoma.:Any special symptom or circumstance that renders the use of a remedy or the carrying out of a procedure inadvisable, usually because of the risk.

Concepts.definition: Receptor tyrosine-protein kinase erbB-2 (1255 aa, ~138 kDa) is encoded by the human ERBB2 gene. This protein is involved in cell proliferation, tyrosine phosphorylation and signal transduction.
A symptom or medical condition that makes a particular treatment or procedure inadvisable because a person is likely to have a bad reaction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
